pullRequest.body:
Also prove that every s-finite measure is the sum of a sigma-finite measure and a measure that takes only the values 0 and infinity.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: I have significantly reworked this PR: `toSigmaFinite` and the associated functions are gone. I added the definition `sigmaFiniteSet`, a set on which an s-finite measure is sigma-finite, and outside of which the measure takes only values 0 and infinity.

:v: RemyDegenne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

bors d+
Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!
I think it'd be nice if you can filter out all the zero measures so that for non-zero measures, Measure.toFinite is a probability measure.

But there might be only finitely many non-zero measures, so the sum of the `2 ^ (-(n+1))` would not be 1 anyway. Perhaps a better way to get that result is to simply rescale the resulting finite measure to turn it into a probability measure (unless it is zero of course, which happens if µ is zero).
Done! `toFinite` is now a probability measure, unless it is zero.

It might be good to define this using [ProbabilityTheory.cond](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Probability/ConditionalProbability.html#ProbabilityTheory.cond) which gives finite measure for free

```suggestion
  If `μ ≠ 0`, this is a probability measure.
```

In the current version of the file, it's not obvious what this construction will be useful for (and in particular what it accomplishes which is not done by `mu.toFinite`). Could you expand on this in the file-level docstring to motivate the construction?

(In particular, would it make sense to avoid altogether this definition, and define two measurable sets on which `mu.densityToFinite = \infty` and `< \infty`, and show that the restriction of `mu` to the former only takes the values 0 and infinity, and the restriction to the latter is sigma-finite?)

Those two sets and the properties of the restrictions (sigma-finite for one, 0/infty for the other) are the content of my next planned PR. Sorry for not having an overview PR for everything. I am not very organized with these contributions.

I agree that `toSigmaFinite` might not be useful. I defined it while writing that code without thinking much about its uses, perhaps only because it felt like a natural thing to define. I'll delete it.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion μ μ.sigmaFiniteSetᶜ = 0 ↔ SigmaFinite μ := ```
You can remove `ht` if you use `Measure.restrict_apply'` in the proof.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: every s-finite measure is absolutely continuous w.r.t. some finite measure
